Uses of Class
org.securecryptoconfig.SCCHash

  • Packages that use SCCHash 
    Package Description
    org.securecryptoconfig
    The Secure Crypto Config Interface provides methods for the most common cryptographic use cases: Symmetric encryption, Asymmetric encryption, hashing, password hashing and Signing.

    • Uses of SCCHash in org.securecryptoconfig

      Methods in org.securecryptoconfig that return SCCHash 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      static SCCHash SCCHash.createFromExistingHash​(byte[] existingSCCHash)
      Returns a SCCHash from byte[] representation of existing SCCHash
      static SCCHash SCCHash.createFromExistingHash​(java.lang.String existingSCCHash)
      Returns a SCCHash from String (Base64) representation of existing SCCHash
      protected static SCCHash SecureCryptoConfig.createHashMessage​(PlaintextContainer plaintext, AlgorithmID id)
      Creation of COSE HashMessage for hashing.
      SCCHash PlaintextContainer.hash()
      Hashing of a plaintext (PlaintextContainer).
      SCCHash SecureCryptoConfig.hash​(byte[] plaintext)
      Hashing of a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
      SCCHash SecureCryptoConfig.hash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
      Hashing of a given plaintext based on the current Secure Crypto Config file.
      SCCHash SCCHash.updateHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext)
      SCCHash of a plaintext.
      SCCHash SecureCryptoConfig.updateHash​(byte[] plaintext, org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash)
      Given a SCCHash of a plaintext: the corresponding plaintext will be hashed again with the current Secure Crypto Config.
      SCCHash SecureCryptoConfig.updateHash​(org.securecryptoconfig.PlaintextContainerInterface plaintext, org.securecryptoconfig.AbstractSCCHash hash)
      Given a SCCHash of a plaintext: the corresponding plaintext will be hashed again with the current Secure Crypto Config.
